commentary_data: RCB were terrific against MI the other day as they kickstarted their campaign in style. Their pacers made the new ball talk, Karn Sharma played a crucial role in the absence of Hasaranga, and then the openers just blew the opposition bowling away. They will miss Reece Topley though after he injured his shoulder in that game. David Willey might replace him today.

Apart from Topley's absence, another challenge for RCB would be facing high-quality spin in the form of Sunil Narine and Varun Chakravarthy. The two openers, Faf du Plessis and Virat Kohli - who set off the fireworks in Bangalore - like pace on the ball. KKR might consider using spin against them early. Both Narine and Chakravarthy have good records against Kohli, while Umesh goes at 10.5rpo against him.

Nitish Rana admitted that there was a lot to learn in KKR's opening defeat against PBKS. He went with his gut feeling and used just the five bowlers in that game, overlooking options like Andre Russell and Anukul Roy. He'll have to be at the top of his game today. And so will the batting lineup. KKR have signed Jason Roy as a replacement player with Shreyas Iyer and Shakib Al Hasan ruled out, but Roy won't be available in this game. So it's unlikely there's going to be any changes in the batting order after just one failure. David Wiese coming in for Tim Southee could be an option worth exploring though, with Lockie Ferguson still doubtful.

The square boundaries are pretty short at the Eden Gardens - one of them being 58 meters, and the bigger one at 70 meters. Straight boundary is slightly longer at 75 meters from one end. 195 is the average first innings score here over the last nine matches and Danny Morrison, doing the , reckons the team batting first will need to get around that kind of score on this pitch.
The RCB middle order this season looks fragile, will be interesting to see KKR spinners take early wickets and put the RCB middle order to test
RCB's top order vs KKR's spinners might decide the fate of this match.

Saurabh Dewangan, I dont think the middle order is fragile, thats a bit harsh although it would be interesting to see them tested. Not to forget about Bracewell whos been in excellent form and scored a hundred recently in a practice game.
Being RCB is not easy, you have likes of Maxwell, Bracewell, DK + 2 Indian domestic players in the middle order still people call it 'fragile'. Saurabh.

Going to have a bowl. Bit of a misunderstanding with the accent there (confusion at the toss). Was dew last night. Hoping it will get skiddy in the second innings. That's a long way away. Today is a completely new game. Really motivated to put in a good performance. Forced change with Topley being injured. Willey comes in.
Was looking to bowl as well because of the dew factor.

Faf apparently called heads at the toss, and it came as heads, but it seemed like the match referee couldn't hear him, hence the little bit of confusion. Sanjay Manjrekar did hear the call though, and confirmed it was Faf who won it.
(Playing XI): Virat Kohli, Faf du Plessis(c), Glenn Maxwell, Michael Bracewell, Dinesh Karthik(w), Shahbaz Ahmed, David Willey, Karn Sharma, Harshal Patel, Akash Deep, Mohammed Siraj
(Playing XI): Mandeep Singh, Rahmanullah Gurbaz(w), Venkatesh Iyer, Nitish Rana(c), Rinku Singh, Andre Russell, Shardul Thakur, Sunil Narine, Tim Southee, Umesh Yadav, Varun Chakaravarthy
So Willey comes in for Topley as expected for RCB. It's the change from KKR that catches attention as

There is a good nervous energy around the group which shows that we care, we had a good start, but we also want to keep continuing the same sort of process and momentum we can achieve over a period of games is what's gonna help us through this IPL. This first month is all about making sure you get the process right and not get too ahead of yourself the second month is where it really counts and you need make sure all your guns blazing and have that constant energy through that second month which is always gonna help you cross the line. There's gonna be a lot of support for us, that's one great thing. The pitch, it looks very different to what it could be, so to see how it will behave - is it gonna turn, is it gonna have less bounce or is it gonna be the usual Eden Gardens wicket which obviously has a lot of runs in it. So, we gotta assess that and make sure we got on top of that real quick.

Guys are excited to be back here. Like most teams, it's just not the captain, there's a number of different leaders throughout teams that help as well. There's number of guys that played a lot of T20 and IPL cricket, Nitish had an experience of captaining Delhi in domestic cricket here, so he is not an inexperienced captain. IN IPL, it is his first time, but he has done a great job so far. There's a couple of class players top of the order (for RCB) that played for a long time and when you play against guys for a long period of time they obviously know a bit about you and hopefully you know a little bit about them as well. They had a great start to the IPL and hopefully we can get off to a winning start here at the Eden Gardens.
Isn't it strange for Nitish as a captain to spell out the impact player right before the match, as Suyash is not in the initial 11?
Okay, so as one of the users pointed out, Suyash isn't in the XI that KKR have announced despite Rana talking of his inclusion at the toss. Will probably come in as the impact player.
Suyash Sharma, Anukul Roy, Vaibhav Arora, N Jagadeesan, David Wiese
Finn Allen, Sonu Yadav, Mahipal Lomror, Suyash Prabhudessai, Anuj Rawat
KKR have made a change at the top with Venkatesh Iyer walking out to open, not Mandeep Singh. Two slips for Siraj. Here we go
Siraj to Gurbaz, no run, ! Short of length delivery slanted in around off, then nips away sharply and Gurbaz is completely squared up in defence!
Siraj to Gurbaz, no run, 135.6kph, back of a length delivery shaping away outside off, Gurbaz leaves it alone
Siraj to Gurbaz, , oh dear! After two good deliveries, Siraj bowls an absolute stinker! It's way down the leg-side, and the keeper can do nothing about it
Siraj to Gurbaz, , oh dear! After two good deliveries, Siraj bowls an absolute stinker! It's way down the leg-side, and the keeper can do nothing about it
Siraj to Gurbaz, no run, good length delivery outside off, shapes away late and Gurbaz lets it go to the keeper
Siraj to Gurbaz, no run, 134.2kph, short of length delivery around off, Gurbaz rides the bounce and fends it in front of backward point

Siraj to Gurbaz, , not great fielding at third man, not a great delivery either! Back of a length outside off, plenty of width for Gurbaz who cuts crisply past backward point. Third man does well to get there after running across, but fumbles and it rolls into the boundary
Siraj to Gurbaz, no run, back of a length delivery on off, straightens a touch as Gurbaz looks to defend and he squirts it off a thick edge towards point
Willey to Venkatesh Iyer, no run, good length delivery slanted in on off, Iyer defends forward
Willey to Venkatesh Iyer, 1 run, back of a length delivery on middle and leg, no swing for Willey in these two balls and Iyer whips it off the hip to deep square leg
RCB think about taking slip out. The fielder goes into the off-side ring, but Faf changes his mind and puts him back at first slip
Willey to Gurbaz, no run, full delivery around middle, Gurbaz defends forward
Willey to Gurbaz, 1 run, 130.7kph, good length delivery on leg, and Gurbaz advances down the track and swings across the line! It goes in the air and falls on the bounce to long leg as he runs across
Willey to Venkatesh Iyer, 1 run, 126.9kph, fuller than a length around off, Iyer gets forward to defend and squirts it off a thick edge behind backward point
Willey to Gurbaz, no run, good length ball on leg, Gurbaz looks to work it through the on-side but it holds on him. Takes a soft leading edge to cover
Siraj to Venkatesh Iyer, no run, 137.8kph, short of length across off, Iyer hangs back and blocks into the off-side
Siraj to Venkatesh Iyer, 1 run, 139.9kph, back of a length on middle, Iyer clips it wide of mid-on
Kohli has an unfortunate knack of giving his wicket to a debutant. Let's see if the mystery spinner Suyash will be able to dismiss him today.
Siraj to Gurbaz, ,  139kph, short of length outside off, and there's plenty of width for Gurbaz. He throws his hands at it and smokes it through point
Slip has been removed

Siraj to Gurbaz, byes, , ! Karthik is beaten behind the stumps as well! Back of a length on off, Gurbaz hangs back to defend but it nips in, goes right through him and bounces over the stumps. The movement is too much to deal with for the keeper

Siraj to Gurbaz, , short of length outside off, Gurbaz initially shimmies down but then adjusts well to the length. He's helped by the width as well. Gets on top of the bounce, opens the face and guides it past short third
Siraj to Gurbaz, , banged in short, Gurbaz ducks under it and it's called a wide for height. Siraj not happy with the call. He urges his captain to review but Faf doesn't go for it
Siraj to Gurbaz, , banged in short, Gurbaz ducks under it and it's called a wide for height. Siraj not happy with the call. He urges his captain to review but Faf doesn't go for it
Siraj to Gurbaz, no run, good length on off, defended forward
Willey to Venkatesh Iyer, no run, 130.1kph, back of a length on off, Iyer hangs back and punches it to mid-on
Willey to Venkatesh Iyer,  Bowled!!

Willey to Venkatesh Iyer,  Bowled!! Sharp movement off the seam, bit of low bounce, and Iyer's stumps are rattled! Willey is pumped! It's a short of length delivery just outside off, Iyer tries punching off the back foot but it cuts back in sharply. Usually the ball would go over the stumps from that length. But not here. It beats the inside edge and crashes into middle and leg!
Willey to Mandeep,  Bowled!!

Willey to Mandeep,  Bowled!! , and this one's an absolute beauty from Willey! Good length delivery slanted away from over the wicket at around 126kph. It pitches around leg, Mandeep gets tentatively forward to defend but it nips away sharply to beat the edge before smashing off stump. Mandeep got completely squared up. I
Willey to Nitish Rana, no run, good length delivery at the stumps, Rana gets forward and defends
Willey to Nitish Rana, no run, full ball shaping away outside off, left alone
Willey to Nitish Rana, no run, another solid forward defence from the KKR captain to finish a superb over. A double-wicket maiden from Willey
Gurbaz has shown positive intent but he needs the batsman at the other end to hold one end so that he can go for his shots freely. Wickets falling at the other end won't help it.
Akash Deep to Gurbaz, no run, 135.6kph, short and wide from Akash Deep to start off, and he's lucky that it doesn't into the boundary. Gurbaz slaps hard but straight to pont
Akash Deep to Gurbaz, , , 138.6kph, short of length into the body, and Gurbaz swivels across nicely to pull it over short fine leg for six. It's a no-ball as well with Akash Deep overstepping

Akash Deep to Gurbaz, 2 runs, goes for the yorker at the pads, doesn't quite nail it but it's full enough to stop Gurbaz from getting under the free-hit. He whips it through midwicket for a couple. The fielder in the deep cuts it off
Akash Deep to Gurbaz, no run, full on middle, Gurbaz pushes to mid-on
Akash Deep to Gurbaz, no run,  135.6kph, good length outside off, Gurbaz charges down and looks to slog it away but doesn't connect
Akash Deep to Gurbaz, leg byes, , that's a poor call from the ump. Clearly came off the bat. Back of a length around off, Gurbaz shuffles across and expertly glances it past short fine for four
Akash Deep to Gurbaz, , banged in short, called a wide as it's too high. Gurbaz was happy to duck
Akash Deep to Gurbaz, , banged in short, called a wide as it's too high. Gurbaz was happy to duck
Akash Deep to Gurbaz, 1 run, back of a length delivery that cuts in slightly, Gurbaz hangs back to defend and gets a thick inside edge onto pad
Willey to Gurbaz, no run, short of length across off, left alone
Willey to Gurbaz, no run, 127.8kph, good length on middle, Gurbaz taps it in front of cover
Willey to Gurbaz, , 127kph, short of length around off, sits up for Gurbaz who whacks the pull over midwicket. Not the length Willey can afford to bowl at his pace

Vekatesh Iyer's fall from reckoning has been quite swift. Not long ago he was touted as the find of the IPL. Reminds me of one Manpreet Goni years ago who was lifted to sky after a few performances and fell back hard and for good.
Willey to Gurbaz, 1 run, 128kph, back of a length on middle and leg, Gurbaz nudges it gently off the back foot into the on-side
Willey to Nitish Rana, 1 run, 128.5kph, back of a length outside off, Rana cuts it to deep point

Willey to Gurbaz, no run, short of length on middle, jags in on Gurbaz as he looks to cut and hits him on the glove! Not a great choice of shot to begin with as he had no room there, and the movement made it worse
Powerplay is done and KKR have got to 47/2! This pitch seems to be on the slower side. Pacers have found early movement though, with Willey taking a double-wicket maiden

A review from RCB for a catch! Rana tries a reverse-sweep off Bracewell's first ball, but it pops up in the air for the keeper. Oh that's come straight off the glove. Having watched the replay, Rana is already walking off before the third umpire can confirm the decision.
M Bracewell to Nitish Rana,  Caught!!

M Bracewell to Nitish Rana,  Caught by Karthik!!  Rana tries a reverse-sweep off Bracewell's first ball, but it pops up in the air for the keeper. Oh that's come straight off the glove. Having watched the replay, Rana is already walking off before the third umpire can confirm the decision.
M Bracewell to Rinku Singh, no run,  There's purchase for Bracewell here. The ball holds on Rinku who hangs back, waits for it and punches it back
M Bracewell to Rinku Singh, no run, again sharp turn off a length. Rinku defends carefully into the off-side
M Bracewell to Rinku Singh, 1 run, floated up, drifting in on middle and leg, Rinku nudges it down to long-on
M Bracewell to Gurbaz, 2 runs, length ball pitching outside off, turns in sharply on middle and leg, and Gurbaz clips it through midwicket
M Bracewell to Gurbaz, 1 run, flat length ball outside off, slides through off the pitch and Gurbaz chops it wide of backward point
M Bracewell to Gurbaz, 1 run, flat length ball outside off, slides through off the pitch and Gurbaz chops it wide of backward point
Given out LBW and . It did look like it came off the glove in real time, and not the pad. And the replay confirms the same

Shahbaz Ahmed to Gurbaz, no run, given out LBW and . It did look like it came off the glove in real time, and not the pad. And the replay confirms the same. It's tossed up on middle, Gurbaz goes for a sweep and gets hit on the glove
Shahbaz Ahmed to Gurbaz, 1 run, floated up on off, Gurbaz gets forward and pushes to long-off
Shahbaz Ahmed to Rinku Singh, 1 run, 88.7kph, flat on leg, Rinku clips it off the back foot behind square
Shahbaz Ahmed to Gurbaz, no run, 94.8kph, flat length ball around off, Gurbaz defends forward
Shahbaz Ahmed to Gurbaz, , this ball is so far wide outside off, but Gurbaz still manages to fetch it as he nails the sweep through square leg!
Shahbaz Ahmed to Gurbaz, no run, floated up on off, quite full, Gurbaz knocks it back down the pitch
M Bracewell to Rinku Singh, 1 run, length ball turning away outside off, Rinku cuts it to sweeper cover
M Bracewell to Gurbaz, ,  Floated up outside off, too full from Bracewell and Gurbaz nails the slog-sweep over wide long-on
M Bracewell to Gurbaz, 1 run, pulls the length back now. Flat length ball around off, Gurbaz punches it to long-on
M Bracewell to Rinku Singh, 1 run, nudged into the on-side for one
M Bracewell to Gurbaz, , slightly short, not that much, but Gurbaz rocks back and pulls over midwicket. Don't think he middled it, but it's good enough
M Bracewell to Gurbaz, 1 run, floated up just outside off, Gurbaz gets forward and works it through square leg

Timeout! Gurbaz going really well for KKR here on a pitch that doesn't look like the easiest for strokeplay. The ball is stopping and gripping sharply for the spinners. There was some movement earlier for the seamers too. Will have to wait and see if dew has an impact on how well the ball comes on later.
Karn Sharma to Gurbaz, no run, lovely legbreak to start from Karn. Lands it on a length around off, turns away and Gurbaz taps it to point
Karn Sharma to Gurbaz, ,  He's scored more than two-thirds of KKR's runs so far. Floated up around middle, Gurbaz gets low and hits it flat over the long leg boundary
Karn Sharma to Gurbaz, no run, defended forward
Karn Sharma to Gurbaz, no run, defended forward
Karn Sharma to Gurbaz, 1 run, legbreak turning away from off, Gurbaz waits on it, opens the face and steers it in front of short third
This is the innings I wanted to see from Gurbaz
Karn Sharma to Rinku Singh, 1 run, flat on leg, turning back in and Rinku clips it through square leg
Karn Sharma to Gurbaz, no run, flat and short outside off, Gurbaz goes after the legbreak looking to slap it away. But he's beaten!

Harshal Patel to Rinku Singh, no run, slower off-cutter to start off from Harshal. It's a good pitch for this kind of variation as the ball is gripping. It's full outside off, Rinku tries steering it through point but is beaten as it cuts away
Youngsters owning this IPL. Go Gurbaz
Harshal Patel to Rinku Singh, 2 runs, slower one on middle, Rinku nudges gently in front of long-on and pushes hard for two. Gets it!
Harshal Patel to Rinku Singh, no run, full outside off, pushed to cover
Harshal Patel to Rinku Singh, 1 run, 114.1kph, pitched up outside off, Rinku drives firmly but is denied by an excellent diving stop from Siraj at mid-off
Harshal Patel to Gurbaz, 1 run, 114kph, slower ball that dips into the blockhole on middle, Gurbaz squeezes it through midwicket
Harshal Patel to Rinku Singh, , poor delivery and Rinku makes him pay! Length ball down the leg-side, normal pace delivery, and Rinku whips it over short fine
It is the best time for KKR  youngsters to prove their worth in the absence of star batters

Karn Sharma to Gurbaz, 2 runs, doesn't get close to the pitch but still slogs hard! This legbreak is fired in wide at 95.6kph, Gurbaz advances, reaches out and drags it off the inside half through midwicket
Karn Sharma to Gurbaz,  Caught!!

Karn Sharma to Gurbaz,  Caught by Akash Deep!! Gurbaz throws his head back in agony as the catch is taken! He went for the reverse-sweep but couldn't keep it down. And a good catch from Akash Deep diving across at short third sends him packing after a good knock.
Karn Sharma to Russell,  Caught!!

Karn Sharma to Russell,  Caught by Kohli!!  It's a legbreak floated up around off, lands in the slot and Russell doesn't hold back despite having just arrived to the crease. He winds up and swings hard but doesn't get hold of it. Comfortably taken at long-off by Kohli. Karn has two in two!

Karn Sharma to Thakur, , nearly a hattrick for Karn! Plenty of flight on this legbreak, Thakur looks to drive but drags it off a thick inside edge past leg stump. Willey fails to keep it inside the boundary
Karn Sharma to Thakur, no run, length ball turning away, Thakur defends into the off-side
Karn Sharma to Thakur, no run, length ball turning away, Thakur defends into the off-side
Karn Sharma to Thakur, 1 run, juicy full toss, Thakur drives to long-off
Akash Deep to Thakur, , back of a length delivery straying on leg, Thakur shuffles across and manages to tickle it fine. The outfield is lightning fast and fine leg is unable to cut it off
Akash Deep to Thakur, , 137.4kph, full outside off, and Thakur throws his hands at it to carve it over extra cover
Faf has a chat with Akash Deep
Akash Deep to Thakur, 1 run, 137.9kph, back of a length on middle, Thakur tabs it in front of backward point
Sanjay Bangar, talking to the host broadcasters, informs that
Akash Deep to Rinku Singh, 1 run, short of length around the waist, Rinku pulls it to deep backward square
Akash Deep to Thakur, 1 run, short and wide, Thakur slaps it in the air and it lands wide of sweeper cover
Akash Deep to Rinku Singh, , 1 run, short of length on off, Rinku pulls it to deep midwicket. Second no-ball from Akash Deep. Oh that's a very tight front foot call
Akash Deep to Thakur, , goes for a leg-stump yorker, doesn't quite get it right and Thakur launches it over long-on to make the most of this free-hit
Karn Sharma to Rinku Singh, 2 runs, full on leg-stump, Rinku clips it away to the left of deep square leg
Karn Sharma to Rinku Singh, 1 run, tossed up on off, driven down the ground to the left of long-on
Karn Sharma to Thakur, 2 runs, Shardul dances down the wicket, doesn't quite get to the pitch of the delivery but manages to slice the lofted drive wide of deep extra cover
Karn Sharma to Thakur, 1 run, Karn Sharma shortens the length and fires it outside off, Shardul punches it off the back foot to long-off
Karn Sharma to Rinku Singh, 1 run, drops it a tad full on middle and leg, wristed along the ground to deep mid-wicket

Karn Sharma to Thakur, , Shardul is crystal-clear in how he wants to approach this innings. I0$ He sinks to one knee, fetches the quicker full delivery from just outside off and slams the slogsweep in the gap between deep mid-wicket and long-on.
M Bracewell to Rinku Singh, 1 run, Rinku Singh crouches and drags the reverse sweep to the right of deep backward point
M Bracewell to Rinku Singh, 1 run, Rinku Singh crouches and drags the reverse sweep to the right of deep backward point
M Bracewell to Thakur, 1 run, steps down the track and whips the quicker delivery to deep mid-wicket
M Bracewell to Rinku Singh, 1 run, slower and wider of off, Rinku drags the sweep to the left of deep mid-wicket

M Bracewell to Thakur, , Shardul is smoking it to all corners. Skates down the pitch and to his delight, the ball spins right into the arc from a juicy length and he's nailed that many-a-mile into the mid-wicket stands
M Bracewell to Thakur, , and again! SRK is happy in the stands. Uses his feet once again, the offbreak turns in from a good length and Shardul sends it soaring over mid-wicket for a mighty maximum
M Bracewell to Thakur, 1 run, hurries down the pitch and forces the quicker delivery off the thick inside half to deep extra cover
Willey to Thakur, no run, cutter bowled on a good length just outside off, Shardul opens the bat face and punches to cover
Just when RCBians flexing to think about having a settled pace attack, Topley's ruling out of the tournament hit us hard! Hopefully, Hazelwood in good shape and provide the much needed balance!

Willey to Thakur, , the slower short ball from David Willey. Shardul stands tall and flat-bats the forehand slap. Hit that so hard that Rinku Singh had to duck for cover and it flies past the diving right hand of mid-off
We are all Just NPC in Lord Thakur's world. He is slaying out there.
Willey to Thakur, no run, dug in short on the stumps, Shardul looks for a ramp and gets beaten by the extra bounce
Willey to Thakur, 1 run, full and wide of off, Shardul stays low and slices the loft that drops well short of the incoming fielder at sweeper cover
Willey to Rinku Singh, no run, slower length delivery that grips and cuts away late outside off, sneaks past the under edge of Rinku Singh - A swing and a miss
Willey to Rinku Singh, , sends in the slower ball bumper that but that's too short and called a wide for height
Willey to Rinku Singh, 1 run, looks to flick a length delivery and gets a thick leading edge to the left of backward point

53/0 off the last 4 overs. Momentum with KKR and there are a couple of decent six-hitters (Narine, Southee and perhaps can add Umesh Yadav to that list as well) to come. The home team will perhaps aim for 200, but should be happy with anything around 180...
Harshal Patel to Rinku Singh, 1 run, slower fullish delivery outside off, Rinku Singh chops it to the right of short third man
Harshal Patel to Rinku Singh, 1 run, slower fullish delivery outside off, Rinku Singh chops it to the right of short third man

Harshal Patel to Thakur, , make way for  Fetches the short ball from outside off and hammers the pull for a one-bounce boundary over mid-wicket. The dug-out is happy, owners are happy and so is his partner at the other end...
"Why is Hasaranga not part of RCB right now?" -- He's part of Sri Lanka's tour to New Zealand. Will join RCB on 10th April
Harshal Patel to Thakur, 1 run, tries for the pull yet again but gets it off the thick top-edge and it drops well short of the fielder at long-on
Harshal Patel to Rinku Singh, 1 run, full and wide of off, Rinku drives it along the ground to sweeper cover
Harshal Patel to Thakur, , full toss and dispatched! Thakur stays deep inside the crease and slogs it square on the leg-side

Harshal Patel to Thakur, 2 runs, Shardul miscues the pull and it drops just short of the fielders running in from deep square and deep mid-wicket. Willey picks it up and fires a sharp throw at the batting end, Shardul seemed to be struggling momentarily but he's managed to drag his bat inside the line just in the nick of time
Lord Thakur batting on different pitch than other players.

Siraj to Rinku Singh, leg byes, 1 run, misses the flick and the ball rolls off the thigh pad to the leg-side, Mohammed Siraj kicks the ball onto the stumps? Or has he dislodged the bails off his boot? Either way, Rinku has made it in safely...
"What about Jos hazlewood???" -- Bangar said Hazlewood will arrive on the 14th, and is likely to play on 17th.
Siraj to Thakur, , slower short ball wide of off, Shardul swings and misses
Siraj to Thakur, , "I0$," says Sanjay Manjrekar on air. It's a full ball outside off and thumped off the strong bottom hand straight of mid-off
Siraj to Thakur, 1 run, misuces the heave to the right of square leg
Siraj to Rinku Singh, no run, Rinku comes dancing down the wicket looking to pull and gets beaten on the inside edge, perhaps was hurried by the skid and pace off the deck

Siraj to Rinku Singh, , , high full toss and signalled a no-ball rightly. Rinku Singh crouches and laps it over the keeper for a maximum. RCB have reviewed and it's clearly above the waist even if Rinku had stayed upright at the crease. The onfield verdict stays...freehit coming up...
Shardul's 63(25) and Rinku's 23(24) tell the whole story ...!!
Siraj to Rinku Singh, 1 run, I0$ full on the pads, Rinku slogs off the cue end to the left of deep mid-wicket
Siraj to Thakur, no run, slower length delivery outside off, Shardul swings and misses
RCB's death over woes continue to haunt them. Siraj and Harshal have to step up otherwise it would be same story all again for RCB.

Harshal Patel to Rinku Singh, no run, , not to be. Rinku looks to slog and gets a thick inside edge onto pad. The ball rolls to the right of the bowler who tries for a direct hit at the bowling end, Thakur was backing up a little too far and would have been out despite the dive...
Harshal Patel to Rinku Singh, , skates down the pitch and thumps it back over the bowler's head, timed it really well did Rinku Singh
Harshal Patel to Rinku Singh, , juicy full toss in the slot just outside off, Rinku Singh says thank you and marmalizes it deep into the mid-wicket stands!
Harshal Patel to Rinku Singh, , juicy full toss in the slot just outside off, Rinku Singh says thank you and marmalizes it deep into the mid-wicket stands!
Harshal Patel to Rinku Singh, , slower length delivery that cuts away past the tramline outside off as Rinku swings and misses
Harshal Patel to Rinku Singh, , flat six!  Advances, fetches the slower length delivery from outside off and wallops it neatly over wide long-on
Harshal Patel to Rinku Singh, no run, slower full delivery outside off, Rinku looks to force it through the off-side and toe-ends it to the left of the bowler
Harshal Patel to Rinku Singh,  Caught!!

Harshal Patel to Rinku Singh,  Caught by Karthik!! No celebrations in the RCB camp. Rinku Singh almost waits for umpire Virender Sharma to raise his finger. Walks off reluctantly. A straightforward decision that. Slower short ball dug into the surface, extracts plenty of bounce and snicks the glove on the attempted pull. Lobs up comfortably for DK behind the stumps.
Siraj to Thakur, , full toss outside off, Shardul slaps it over extra cover with disdain. Gee, this lad's got some bottom hand power...
Siraj to Thakur, 1 run, shortens the length outside off, Shardul slices it to the left of sweeper cover
Siraj to Narine, leg byes, 1 run, Narine looks to slog and misses, the ball deflects high off the front pad to the right of short third
Siraj to Thakur,  Caught!!

Siraj to Thakur,  Caught by Maxwell!! One-handed six? Nope. Gone. Siraj digs in the slower ball bumper, gets a tennis-ball like bounce and it messes up with the timing of Shardul Thakur. Looks for the pull and the bottom hand comes off the blade before completing the bat swing, loops up off the top-edge and Maxi settles under it at long-on.
Siraj to Umesh Yadav, , when Umesh Yadav hits, it stays hit. Gives it all on this mighty hack and he's got enough power to clear mid-off.
Siraj to Umesh Yadav, 2 runs, top-edges the pull and it lands well wide of the rushing Siraj to his right at mid-wicket, he slips on the slide and enables an easy second for the duo

At 89/5 in the 12th over, with Andre Russell gone for a golden duck, not even the best of pundits saw this coming. Shardul Thakur's first ball went for four, thanks to a huge inside edge to deny a hat-trick for Karn Sharma. But the rest of his innings was anything but luck. He took the attack to the opposition with fearless approach and helped KKR score 46 off the next 3 overs (13-15). Having gained some much-needed momentum, the home team never looked back. Rinku was more than happy to play the second fiddle during the 103-run partnership, and only switched gears in the 19th over where he smoked Harshal for a couple of sixes and a four before getting out off the last ball. That said, the night, so far, clearly belongs to one man - Shardul Lord Thakur. Not only did he bring his maiden IPL fifty, but he unleashed his bottom hand power and smacked RCB bowlers to all corners. The outfield appears to be really rapid and the track, quite placid. Can RCB go 2 in 2? We will find out shortly, back in a bit...

We had a very good partnership (Thakur and him). We spoke about taking to the end and not giving wickets. My plan was to stick around. He (Thakur) was striking it well so kept handing it over to him. The pitch is slow and we've got a very good total.
Hello again! All in readiness for the chase. Umesh Yadav to kickstart proceedings with the ball...

Umesh Yadav to Kohli, , Virat Kohli was casually shaking his head listening to the peppy music from DJ before the first ball and he's dispatched the first ball with supreme ease. A half-volley down leg and it's been clipped away to the fine leg fence with great timing
Umesh Yadav to Kohli, no run, back of a length outside off, Kohli cuts but can't beat the fielder at backward point
Umesh Yadav to Kohli, 1 run, fuller on middle and leg, Kohli clips it to the right of mid-wicket
Umesh Yadav to du Plessis, no run, swings in from a good length around off, beats Faf on the inside edge and hits him on the side of the tummy. "" says his former team-mate Chris Morris on air...
Umesh Yadav to du Plessis, 1 run, on a length just outside off, nudged away into the leg-side for a quick single

Umesh Yadav to Kohli, , the starter was served first ball of the over, Kohli was waiting for the main course and Umesh Yadav is kind enough to offer it real quick. A short and wide hit-me, Kohli frees his hands and scythes it in the gap between short third and backward point
Southee to du Plessis, no run, swinging away from a length outside off, beats the flashing blade of Faf. Didn't really go hard, but there was enough movement in the air and off the deck...
Southee to du Plessis, 1 run, opens the bat face and taps the length delivery in front of cover for a quick single

Southee to Kohli, no run, comes walking down the wicket looking to push/flick the ball in the V, but Southee is smart enough to hit the fullish length and beat the outside edge with a sharp outswinger
Southee to Kohli, no run, gets across and flick-drives the full delivery to the left of mid-on
Southee to Kohli, no run, jumps out of the crease and looks to slap Southee over mid-off, swing and extra bounce takes it past the outside edge
Southee to Kohli, 1 run, presses forward and works the ball wide of mid-wicket for an easy single
Umesh Yadav to Kohli, 2 runs, steps down the wicket and mistimes the slap over mid-on, Narine runs back and keeps it down to a couple
Umesh Yadav to Kohli, no run, back of a length outside off, Kohli cuts to the left of cover
Umesh Yadav to Kohli, no run, back of a length outside off, Kohli cuts to the left of cover
Umesh Yadav to Kohli, no run, on a length outside off, Kohli opens the bat face and punches to backward point
Umesh Yadav to Kohli, 1 run, full outside off, Kohli drills the drive to the left of mid-off and nabs a quick single
Umesh Yadav to du Plessis, , anything full and Faf ain't gonna let that go scot-free. The bat face turns on impact but he's got enough power on the lofted drive over extra cover
Umesh Yadav to du Plessis, no run, shortens the length outside off, Faf cuts to the left of cover
Southee to Kohli, , skips down the track, meets the ball on a fuller length and tonks it back over the bowler's head with absolute disdain. Sheer dominance from Virat Kohli...
Southee to Kohli, 3 runs, flicks the full delivery to the right of wide long-on, Varun fumbles on the dive and enables an extra run for the duo
Southee to du Plessis, , fullish length outside off, Faf clears his front leg and sends it soaring straight down the ground for a maximum
Southee to du Plessis, , full and wide, Faf flays it over extra cover with terrific timing! Save your legs.
Southee to du Plessis, , Tim Southee is getting belted to all corners. Slower full delivery at the pads, Faf picks it up nonchalantly and whips it deep into the mid-wicket stands...
Southee to du Plessis, no run, good length on the stumps, pushed to the right of the bowler.
Narine to Kohli, no run, opens the bat face and dabs the flatter delivery to short third
Narine to Kohli, 1 run, clipped away to square leg and they rush through to complete a quick single. Shardul pings a direct hit at the bowling end but Kohli is well in...
Narine to du Plessis, 1 run, drifting in from a fuller length just outside off, nudged away into the mid-wicket pocket
Narine to Kohli, no run, full on middle and leg, flicked away to square leg
Narine to Kohli,  Bowled!!

Narine to Kohli,  Bowled!! Knocks him over. The classic offbreak. Bowls it on an in-between length and gets the ball to spin enough to hit the top of off. Kohli wasn't fully forward, tries to flick leg-side but ends up playing down the wrong line and pays the price.
Narine to M Bracewell, 1 run, tad quicker and flatter outside off, Bracewell flicks and gets it off the thick inside half to deep backward square leg
Narine to M Bracewell, 1 run, tad quicker and flatter outside off, Bracewell flicks and gets it off the thick inside half to deep backward square leg
Chakaravarthy to M Bracewell, 1 run, full outside off, Bracewell looks to drive and slices it off the outer edge to short third man
Chakaravarthy to du Plessis,  Bowled!!

Chakaravarthy to du Plessis,  Bowled!! Did someone just click on the replay of Kohli's dismissal? The only difference is an inside edge. Once again the lack of footwork is very evident. Faf tries to force a fullish delivery from outside off through the off-side and skews it off the thick inside edge onto his middle and off. Wasn't really forward neither back. Timber! It was a googly and the RCB skipper clearly didn't pick it.
Chakaravarthy to Maxwell, no run, quicker and just outside off, Maxwell pushes it to the left of cover
Chakaravarthy to Maxwell, no run, spins in from a length towards leg-stump, Maxwell misses the flick and wears it high on the front pad
Chakaravarthy to Maxwell, , full and wide of off, Maxwell forces the drive on the up and puts it in the gap between cover and extra cover

Chakaravarthy to Maxwell, no run, shortens the length and keeps it outside off, Maxwell goes hard and gets a thick inside edge that skims past the top of off. Lots of oohs and aahs around the bat there...
Narine to M Bracewell, 1 run, fuller on off, eased down the ground towards long-on
Narine to Maxwell, 1 run, full on leg-stump, clipped away to the right of long-on
Narine to M Bracewell, no run, opens the bat face and drives the full delivery to cover

Narine to M Bracewell, no run, jumps down the wicket and gets beaten by the late inward drift and spin, hit high on the front pad or perhaps there was an inside edge onto pad? The impact looked just outside off as well...
Narine to M Bracewell, 1 run, nudged away to deep mid-wicket
Narine to Maxwell, no run, full outside off, Maxwell drives to the left of cover. A slight fumble but they don't risk the quick single...
KKR has one of the best spin bowling attack in this IPL.
Chakaravarthy to M Bracewell, 1 run, full ball on leg, Bracewell kneels and sweeps it to the fielder at deep backward square leg
Chakaravarthy to Maxwell,  Bowled!!

Chakaravarthy to Maxwell,  Bowled!!  This one is quicker and flatter on a length outside off, Maxwell tries something audacious as he tries to hammer it across the line but the ball turns in, beats the inside edge, and crashes into the off-stump. Always a risk trying to play across the line on a track where the ball is gripping and turning. RCB are in big trouble.

Chakaravarthy to Maxwell,  Bowled!!  This one is quicker and flatter on a length outside off, Maxwell tries something audacious as he tries to hammer it across the line but the ball turns in, beats the inside edge, and crashes into the off-stump. Always a risk trying to play across the line on a track where the ball is gripping and turning. RCB are in big trouble.
Chakaravarthy to Harshal Patel, no run, tossed up ball outside off, driven to the fielder at extra cover
Chakaravarthy to Harshal Patel,  Bowled!!

Chakaravarthy to Harshal Patel,  Bowled!! The promotion for Harshal Patel up the order fails! The back of the hand ball from Chakaravarthy outside off, there's some room on offer as well. Harshal Patel tries to cash in as he goes for an expansive drive. However, he gets an inside edge that crashes into the stumps. All the four wickets have fallen to poor shots you can say. Yes, the spinners have bowled well but it has been irresponsible from the RCB batters.
Chakaravarthy to Shahbaz Ahmed, no run, tossed up ball outside off, defended besides the pitch on the off-side
Chakaravarthy to Shahbaz Ahmed, no run, quicker one on middle, Shahbaz Ahmed leans ahead and defends it to the right of Chakaravarthy.
Narine to M Bracewell, 1 run, drifting into Bracewell as he flicks this one to deep mid-wicket
Narine to Shahbaz Ahmed, byes, , some respite for RCB! Full ball outside off, Shahbaz Ahmed goes for a sweep but misses. Gurbaz is put off as he gets beaten and the ball races to the fence
Narine to Shahbaz Ahmed, 1 run, slower through the air, Shahbaz Ahmed shuffles and works it to deep mid-wicket
Sad to say this as an RCBian. It seems like the same old story again.
Narine to M Bracewell, 1 run, Bracewell comes down the track and Narine fires it in. Tucked to deep mid-wicket
RCB choosing lucky draw method to decide batting position except opening pair
Narine to Shahbaz Ahmed,  Caught!!

Narine to Shahbaz Ahmed,  Caught by Thakur!!  Everything happening too quickly! They have lost four wickets only for 17 runs. Tossed up full ball outside off, Shahbaz Ahmed reverses his stance and goes for the reverse hit. Makes good connection but he fails to find the gap. Thakur at deep backward point takes an easy catch.

Anything above 200 is a tall ask and RCB are crumbling under pressure. It started with the departure of Kohli, and it's been a procession since then. Narine and Chakaravarthy have bowled well in tandem, sharing all the wickets to fall so far between them. RCB need something miraculous to turn things around
Narine to Karthik, no run, full ball on off, driven with the spin to mid-on
Chakaravarthy to M Bracewell, leg byes, 1 run, on a length on leg, Bracewell looks to turn it away but the ball deflects off his pads towards short fine leg. The batters steal a run
Chakaravarthy to Karthik, 1 run, this one turns the other way and it's outside off, cut away with the spin to deep backward point
Chakaravarthy to M Bracewell, , short ball outside off, Bracewell stands tall and cuts it past backward point to find the fence
Chakaravarthy to M Bracewell, , short ball outside off, Bracewell stands tall and cuts it past backward point to find the fence
Chakaravarthy to M Bracewell, no run, full ball on off, eased back to Chakaravarthy
Chakaravarthy to M Bracewell, 1 run, short ball outside off, cut away to sweeper cover
Chakaravarthy to Karthik, 1 run, on a length well outside off, Karthik crouches and fetches the sweep to hit it towards deep square leg. Umesh moves to his left and keeps the batters down to a single
The Impact player. Suyash Sharma comes on for a bowl. He is being called as a mystery bowler. Let's see how he operates
Suyash Sharma to Karthik, 1 run, starts off with a googly outside off, Karthik rocks back and cuts it to wide long-off
Suyash Sharma to M Bracewell, no run, another off-spinner on off, M Bracewell comes down the track and can only bunt it back towards the bowler
Suyash Sharma to M Bracewell, , poor ball and duly punished! A half-tracker, asking to be hit, Bracewell doesn't miss out as he smokes the pull over deep mid-wicket for a maximum
Suyash Sharma to M Bracewell, 1 run, another googly but the line and length is awry, a lot of time for Bracewell to pull it towards deep backward square leg
Suyash Sharma to Karthik, 1 run, spinning in from a length outside off, Karthik looks to pull it hard but gets an inside towards mid-wicket
Suyash Sharma to M Bracewell, no run, quicker and flatter outside off, punched with the spin to extra cover
Certainly a big ask but a big partnership in quick time might give them some momentum
Thakur to Karthik, ,  A shortish ball outside off, Karthik stands tall and nails the pull through mid-wicket. No chance for the man in deep to cut it off
Thakur to Karthik, 1 run, full ball angling in on middle and leg, flicked away to deep backward square leg
Thakur to M Bracewell,  Caught!!

Thakur to M Bracewell,  Caught by Nitish Rana!!  The stars have aligned for him and he can do nothing wrong tonight. A sharp short ball around leg, Bracewell doesn't have much space to work with but he still goes for a hook shot. Ends up gloving it towards short fine leg. Rana runs in a bit and dives to take a fine catch.
Thakur to Anuj Rawat, no run, back of a length ball on middle, Anuj Rawat hangs back and blocks it down the track
Thakur to Anuj Rawat, no run, a pacy short ball on leg, seaming away. Anuj Rawat arches his back and drops his wrists to let it go
Thakur to Anuj Rawat, 1 run, an off-pace ball outside off, Anuj Rawat waits for it and dabs it to third man to keep strike
Suyash Sharma to Anuj Rawat, no run, a googly outside off, spinning away, Anuj Rawat lets it go. He wants a wide but umpire feels it was fine
Suyash Sharma to Anuj Rawat,  Caught!!

Suyash Sharma to Anuj Rawat,  Caught by Narine!!  Big moment for the youngster. He is cock-a-hoop! Tossed up outside off and spinning away, Anuj Rawat kneels down and tries to slog sweep it against the spin but only manages to get a top-edge. The ball lobs towards short third man and Narine pouches it gleefully!
Suyash Sharma to Willey, no run, spinning away on a length from around off, driven off the front foot towards covers
Suyash Sharma to Willey, 1 run, on a length on leg, Willey works it against the spin to mid-wicket
Suyash Sharma to Karthik, , tries a quicker one but gets it all wrong. It is too short and goes beyond the tramline
Suyash Sharma to Karthik,  Caught!!

Suyash Sharma to Karthik,  Caught by Chakaravarthy!! KKR are ruling the roost at Eden Gardens! The youngster gets the better of Karthik and it is definitely a moment for him worth cherishing! Tossed up full ball outside off, Karthik goes for an expansive drive through covers but only manages to get it off the outer half of his bat. The ball lobs towards short third man. Chakravarthy moves to his right and catches it. KKR only two wickets away from a big victory.
Suyash Sharma to Karn Sharma, no run, this one pitches on off and turns away, goes past Karn Sharma's poking blade. An appeal for a caught behind but there was no bat involved

Safe to say that the game is almost done and dusted. Just a matter of time that KKR win this one. But, RCB need to add as many runs as possible to their tally as lower the margin of defeat, the better it will be for them.
Thakur to Willey, 1 run, back of a length ball on middle and leg, worked off the back foot to deep mid-wicket
Thakur to Karn Sharma, 1 run, short of length ball outside off, placed to deep backward point
Thakur to Willey, , shot! Back of a length ball outside off, Willey stands tall and punches it crisply through covers for a rocketing boundary

Thakur to Willey, 2 runs, the knuckle ball from Thakur outside off, Willey reads it well and cuts it past backward point. The fielder in the deep slides to his right and keeps the batters down to a couple

Thakur to Willey, 2 runs, the knuckle ball from Thakur outside off, Willey reads it well and cuts it past backward point. The fielder in the deep slides to his right and keeps the batters down to a couple
Thakur to Willey, no run, slower back of a length ball outside off, cut away straight to backward point
Thakur to Willey, 1 run, short of length ball outside off, Willey taps it through covers to retain strike
Suyash Sharma to Willey, no run, tossed up ball outside off, Willey goes for an expansive drive but gets it off the outer half towards short third man
Suyash Sharma to Willey, 1 run, floated full ball outside off, driven past extra cover. Long-off moves to his right and tidies up. A couple taken
KKR review for an lbw decision. Looks close to the naked eye. Well, there's a bottom edge involved, so no lbw. Rana took the catch so the review works for KKR.
Suyash Sharma to Karn Sharma,  Caught!!

Suyash Sharma to Karn Sharma,  Caught by Nitish Rana!! Tossed up ball, Karn Sharma tries to slog sweep it but seems to have missed it to be rapped on the pads. The ball also lobs to Rana at slip and he takes it. A loud shout follows but the umpire stays put. Suyash Sharma is confident and KKR take the review. UltraEdge shows there's an edge. So, the catch is checked and Rana took it cleanly.
Suyash Sharma to Akash Deep, 1 run, full ball, heaved away but it lands just short of deep square leg
Suyash Sharma to Willey, 1 run, short one outside off, punched away to deep extra cover
Suyash Sharma to Akash Deep, , tossed up ball around off, Akash Deep kneels down and slog sweeps it over mid-wicket for a one-bounce boundary

I joined the stream before the match started and had to drop off for work only to come back again now. Guess those people at start who said KKR need only use their spinners to eat a fragile middle order must be celebrating right now.
Narine to Willey, 2 runs, Willey turns this one towards deep mid-wicket with soft hands. The batters take on the fielder's arm and come back safely for the couple
RCB vs KKR is either a no contest or going down to wire. There is nothing in between
Narine to Willey, no run, on a length outside off, punched with the spin towards extra cover
Narine to Willey, no run, coming in with the arm sharply, Willey looks to tuck it away but is hit high on the pads
Narine to Willey, no run, Willey tries to defend the tossed up ball outside off but is beaten by the sharp turn
Narine to Willey, 1 run, coming in with the arm, turned to deep mid-wicket
Narine to Akash Deep, , on a length outside off, Akash Deep kneels down and tries to hit it across the line but only manages an under edge. Goes through Gurbaz in a flash and runs to the fence behind
Finally, a match that will end on time.
Suyash Sharma to Willey, no run, on a length outside off, spinning away, Willey looks to force it through the off-side but misses
Suyash Sharma to Willey, no run, on a length outside off, spinning away, Willey looks to force it through the off-side but misses
Suyash Sharma to Willey, no run, on a length outside off, spinning away, Willey looks to force it through the off-side but misses
Suyash Sharma to Willey, , tossed up ball outside off, Willey gets underneath it and smashes it down the ground for a one-bounce boundary
Suyash Sharma to Willey, , tossed up ball outside off, Willey gets underneath it and smashes it down the ground for a one-bounce boundary
Suyash Sharma to Willey, 1 run, slower through the air outside off, pushed with soft hands towards cover point
Suyash Sharma to Willey, 1 run, slower through the air outside off, pushed with soft hands towards cover point
Deep mid-wicket goes closer to the fence
Deep mid-wicket goes closer to the fence

Suyash Sharma to Akash Deep, , where did that come from? What a hit from the No. 11! Tossed up ball outside off, Akash Deep skips down the track, converts it into a half-volley, and tonks it way back into the long-on stands

Suyash Sharma to Akash Deep, , where did that come from? What a hit from the No. 11! Tossed up ball outside off, Akash Deep skips down the track, converts it into a half-volley, and tonks it way back into the long-on stands
Suyash Sharma to Akash Deep, 1 run, low full-toss on leg, Akash Deep goes for a big hit but the bat turns in his hands. Ends up slicing it towards long-off
Suyash Sharma to Akash Deep, 1 run, low full-toss on leg, Akash Deep goes for a big hit but the bat turns in his hands. Ends up slicing it towards long-off
Suyash Sharma to Willey, no run, quicker one on off, played with soft hands to mid-wicket. Suyash Sharma runs across to it to stop it.
Suyash Sharma to Willey, no run, quicker one on off, played with soft hands to mid-wicket. Suyash Sharma runs across to it to stop it.
Chakaravarthy to Akash Deep, 1 run, short ball outside off, flat-batted to long-off for a run
Chakaravarthy to Akash Deep, 1 run, short ball outside off, flat-batted to long-off for a run
Chakaravarthy to Willey, 1 run, on a length, spinning away, Willey camps back and turns it towards deep mid-wicket
Chakaravarthy to Willey, 1 run, on a length, spinning away, Willey camps back and turns it towards deep mid-wicket
Chakaravarthy to Akash Deep, no run, on a length on middle and leg, Akash Deep stays back and defends it
Chakaravarthy to Akash Deep, no run, on a length on middle and leg, Akash Deep stays back and defends it
Chakaravarthy to Akash Deep,  Caught&Bowled!!
Chakaravarthy to Akash Deep,  Caught&Bowled!!

Chakaravarthy to Akash Deep,  Caught&Bowled!! That's the final nail in the coffin! What a catch from Chakaravarthy to finish things off. He ends with a 4-fer, a night to remember! Tossed up ball outside off, Akash Deep looks to slog sweep it but ends up getting a top-edge. The ball skies to the mid-on region. Chakaravarthy and Gurbaz are after it. The former calls for it and takes an outstanding catch as he dives behind.

Chakaravarthy to Akash Deep,  Caught&Bowled!! That's the final nail in the coffin! What a catch from Chakaravarthy to finish things off. He ends with a 4-fer, a night to remember! Tossed up ball outside off, Akash Deep looks to slog sweep it but ends up getting a top-edge. The ball skies to the mid-on region. Chakaravarthy and Gurbaz are after it. The former calls for it and takes an outstanding catch as he dives behind.

A night to remember for KKR whereas a night to forget for RCB! The momentum shift started from the 13th over, when Thakur came in and took charge. Before that, the hosts were in a precarious situation at 89/5. Thakur smashed 68 off 29 balls, and Rinku played a good hand as well alongwith a fine fifty from Gurbaz at the top of the order. KKR went back into the dressing room on a high. And sometimes, momentum matters a lot in a dynamic format like T20. Kohli and Faf did start decently but once the former was bamboozled by Narine, the procession started. The pitch did take turn and grip but the visitors will be disappointed with themselves as a lot of their players got out to poor shots. The KKR spinners took 9 out of the 10 wickets to fall, that tells you the story! Narine, Chakaravarthy, and the debutant, Suyash Sharma, had a great night. Not to forget, Lord Shardul Thakur - he was the one who turned the game on its head with a scintillating knock! RCB will be shell-shocked but they themselves have to blame for it. Stick around for the presentations..

We had set it up nicely with the ball, probably at 100/5 around 13 overs, we kind of gave away 20-25 runs extra on that wicket. Shardul played incredibly well, he took the game away from us and KKR's leg-spinners bowled brilliantly. They got on top of us, with Narine and Chakaravarthy, they put the squeeze on us really well. Because that's the nature of leg spinners or mystery spinners. It was still a good wicket, our batting was very average and even when we lose games like these we need to ensure that we get close to the target, at least around 160 tonight. The game of T20 cricket moves so fast, we will try and learn our lessons, just making sure we tweak things we work on. It's fair to say tonight, it got a little bit away from us, tactically we could have been a little better. Death bowling is never the easiest jobs to do, Siraj and Harshal are quality bowlers at the death and just need to make sure, we work on our plans a little bit.

It's a good win. The way boys have shown character looking at the initial stage after losing early wickets. Good sign that we bounced back to score 200-plus. We expected the pitch to help spinners but you need runs on the board. Have to congratulate Shardul Thakur and Rinku Singh for the way they batted. Varun bowled extremely well, even Sunny. And the newcomer provided support. We saw him in trial matches and were extremely happy with the way he bowled. He's quick through the air, difficult to pick. He's inexperienced but shows a very good attitude.

We expected the pitch to help spinners but you need runs on the board. Have to congratulate Shardul Thakur and Rinku Singh for the way they batted. Varun bowled extremely well, even Sunny. And the newcomer provided support. We saw him in trial matches and were extremely happy with the way he bowled. He's quick through the air, difficult to pick. He's inexperienced but shows a very good attitude.

In the previous match, there were a lot of positives. We were seven down but still we fought. Today we showed great fight. Gurbaz played a brilliant knock at the top of the order and Thakur changed the complexion of the game. Credit should also be given to Rinku as he played second fiddle to Thakur and paced his innings well. Umesh and Southee started decently with the ball. Then, our spinners bowled really well. Taking wickets regularly was great for us. Suyash is a confident young man and he has belief in himself. He made his chance count and it was great to see him bowl that way.

In the previous match, there were a lot of positives. We were seven down but still we fought. Today we showed great fight. Gurbaz played a brilliant knock at the top of the order and Thakur changed the complexion of the game. Credit should also be given to Rinku as he played second fiddle to Thakur and paced his innings well. Umesh and Southee started decently with the ball. Then, our spinners bowled really well. Taking wickets regularly was great for us. Suyash is a confident young man and he has belief in himself. He made his chance count and it was great to see him bowl that way.

I don't even know where it came from but looking at the scorecard at that time, everyone would have thought we are struggling. But your subconscious mind takes over. You also have to have skills to do that at the higher level, but we also work hard in the nets. There is a period where we can slog it in the nets. Coaching staff do the throwdowns, and give us the option of range-hitting. And you know the pitches - they always suit the batsmen, don't they? Suyash bowled exceptionally well, and we know the quality Sunil and Varun have. They have fun, take wickets. This was a perfect day.

KKR would be extremely happy to rule the roost at their home ground, Eden Gardens. It was after a period of four years that IPL returned here and boy, their players have responded in style! Contrasting fortunes for RCB. They started with a bang in their opening game against MI but fell down in a significant manner tonight. Lucknow Super Giants return to their home ground again as they will play hosts to Sunrisers Hyderabad tomorrow. Do tune in to catch all the action. This is  signing off on behalf of , and . Till then, goodbye and cheers!
